Cherry.js, do it sweety!

For the cocktail, we created some JavaScript functions to get the best of your webstite.

Show modal

Basic usage (also with button markup):

<!-- Modal call: you can add your custom class to the modal call and the features in the table -->
<a href="javascript:void(0)" class="call-modal" modal-target="myModal">Show modal</a>

<!-- The modal content -->
<div class="content-modal" id="myModal">
 ...
</div>
Attribute Required Description
class="call-modal ..." required Class name to call the modal event, possibility to overload the after with your own classes.
modal-target="yourModalName" required Target the content of your modal with the same id of your modal.
modal-dismiss optionnal Attribute with no value. This attribute add the close button on the top-right of the modal.
